HAH! No...... Don't bother with it, won't work. SoundSpectrum is smart.

This is a great torrent..
If anyone is interested, this is a simple fix to stop this from de-registering.
All you have to do is make sure you're not connected to the internet the first time you start g-force.  I switched my airport off before install, registered with the serial and then unchecked "Check for updates on startup" in the standalone version. After that you're sound as a pound.

Found a solution to avoid the problem when installing a previous package after installing and uninstalling the trial version package 3.9.4,

It states that there's a previous version installed, although one has sent all traces of the software to trash, and prevents the installer from choosing Mackintosh HD as a destination folder.

There's TWO HIDDEN FILES in

MackintoishHD /private/var/db/receipts

1) com.SoundSpectrum.......pkg.plist
2) com.SoundSpectrum.......pkg.bom

After finding and deleting those two files, installation of a previous version package runs swell.

Don't know if it helps, but there's surely this .plist file, which has been hard to find, that maybe is messing with your license issue. Just Try and tell me later.
Augh! Please seed! I'll seed for a while as well.
